intro: Ardisia pteropoda, commonly known as the winged ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers that appear in the axils of the leaves. Following flowering, it produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia pteropoda is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal fruit display.
